title: Care Plan Entry and Tracking UI
description:
Create Comprehensive Care Plan Management System with Goals, Interventions, and Progress Tracking

Build a healthcare care plan management interface that enables providers to create, track, and evaluate patient care plans through structured goal setting, intervention planning, and systematic progress monitoring.

Core Components:

Care Plan Form Structure:
- Multi-section form with tabbed or stepped navigation (Overview, Goals, Interventions, Progress)
- Patient identification header with name, MRN, DOB, and care team assignment
- Care plan metadata: creation date, start date, review date, next review date, responsible provider
- Draft vs. finalized status with workflow transitions
- Comprehensive validation: required fields, date logic, goal-intervention relationships
- Warning prompts when navigating away from unsaved changes

Goal Management Section:
- Dynamic goal list with add/remove/reorder capabilities
- Per-goal fields: title, detailed description, measurable success criteria, target date, priority level (high/medium/low), category/domain (clinical, functional, psychosocial)
- Goal status lifecycle: draft → active → achieved/revised/discontinued
- Progress percentage or milestone tracking per goal
- Timestamped progress updates with free-text notes
- Goal dependency tracking (if goal B requires goal A completion)
- Visual status indicators (color-coded badges, progress bars)

Intervention Management Section:
- Parent-child relationship: interventions explicitly linked to goals
- Intervention details: intervention name, type/category, detailed description, frequency/schedule, duration, responsible party/discipline, start date, end date
- Status tracking: planned → in-progress → completed/discontinued
- Occurrence logging: scheduled vs. actual completion with date/time stamps
- Supporting documentation: attach protocols, clinical guidelines, patient education materials
- Ability to associate one intervention with multiple goals

Progress Monitoring Dashboard:
- Goal-level progress visualization: progress bars, status icons, trend indicators
- Timeline view showing all progress updates chronologically
- Progress note entry form: date, author, goal reference, free-text notes, outcome measurements
- Outcome measurement capture: numeric values with units, qualitative assessments, standardized scales
- Baseline vs. current comparison view
- Filterable progress history (by date range, goal, provider)
- Summary reports: goals achieved, interventions completed, overall plan status

Data Persistence and Audit Trail:
- Auto-save every 30 seconds or after significant field changes
- Manual save and "Save as Draft" options
- Complete version history: timestamp, user, fields changed, old/new values
- Read-only view of previous versions with diff highlighting
- Audit log for care plan finalization, goal status changes, major edits
- Review and approval workflow for care plan updates

User Experience Requirements:
- Responsive layout supporting desktop, tablet, mobile
- Contextual help icons with tooltips explaining field purposes
- Field-level validation with inline error messages
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance: keyboard navigation, screen reader support, color contrast
- Confirmation modals for: deleting goals/interventions, discontinuing active items, navigating with unsaved changes
- Loading states and progress indicators for save operations
- Success/error notifications for user actions

Edge Cases and Business Rules:
- Empty state handling: care plan with no goals displays prompt to add first goal
- Prevent goal deletion if progress notes exist; require status change to discontinued instead
- Allow intervention discontinuation but preserve historical occurrence data
- Support one-to-many relationships: single goal with multiple interventions
- Concurrent edit detection: warn users if another provider has modified the care plan
- Handle future-dated review dates with reminder/notification system
- Manage care plan expiration: auto-flag plans past review date requiring update
- Support goal revision workflow: creating new version while maintaining original goal history
- Validate date logic: target dates must be future dates, end dates after start dates
- Handle provider reassignment: update responsible party while maintaining original author attribution

Technical Considerations:
- Define data schema for goals, interventions, progress notes, and relationships
- Implement optimistic UI updates with rollback on save failure
- Plan for offline capability or clear messaging when connectivity lost
- Consider performance with large care plans (20+ goals, 50+ interventions)
- Design API endpoints for CRUD operations on care plan entities
- Implement proper authorization: who can view, edit, finalize, delete care plans

Success Criteria:
- Provider can create complete care plan with 5+ goals and associated interventions in under 10 minutes
- All user actions persist correctly with full audit trail
- Progress tracking updates reflect immediately in dashboard visualizations
- Zero data loss during auto-save or session interruptions
- 100% WCAG AA compliance verified through automated and manual testing
- System handles concurrent editing gracefully without data corruption
